lessons.name: Beamer HDMI connection
lessons.Slide 0: In this lesson we will see how to connect your laptop with the beamer, by using the HDMI cable.
lessons.Slide 1: Take the HDMI cable of the beamer, usually located there and connect it to the HDMI port of your laptop.
lessons.Slide 2: Your screen should be projected automatically on the wall
lessons.Slide 3: In case it is not, press the tade button on the remote control of the beamer, located there

lessons.name: Operate the lights
lessons.Slide 0: Most of the lights throughout the Welten Institute are automatic, although there is the possibility of turning them off when you want.
lessons.Slide 1: Next to the door there is a small controller, mounted on the wall.
lessons.Slide 2: By using this you can operate the lights as you want.
lessons.Slide 3: Too much light during your presentation? Not a problem with the remote at hand!

lessons.name: Operate the shutters
lessons.Slide 0: Is the weather good, but the shutters are down? Is the sunlight bothering you? Don't worry!
lessons.Slide 1: Although the shutters work automatically, you can still operate them yourself, making the environment more to your liking
lessons.Slide 2: On the walls, a bit under the windows, you will find some small switches with arrows pointing up and down painted on them.
lessons.Slide 3: By pressing them, and keeping them pressed, you can put the shutters to your desired height.
